okavango_delta.caption_text:
A few years ago, I had the opportunity to organize all land operations for a loyalty tour of Group Leaders from the US to Botswana. I was fortunate enough to be invited to join the trip as a staff member, traveling alongside Kerryann Driscoll, the current President of Travel in Zürich, and Mike Shafer, the Director of Sales. One of the Group Leaders, Kristen Kames, brought a t-shirt for each traveler along with a thoughtful thank-you note. On one of the final days, we gathered for a group photo. While the EF logo isn’t clearly visible due to the quality of the picture, I want to emphasize the deeper meaning of this moment. By the end of our two-week trip, we had become like family. We’re still in touch through a Facebook group, and Kristen, who didn’t know any of us beforehand, made the effort to ask for everyone’s names and t-shirt sizes in advance, sharing her excitement about traveling to Africa for the first time.
Traveling with this incredible group of EF customers in Africa ignited my own passion for exploring the continent, and it became my travel destination in the following years. That’s the power of EF: strangers become family, friends, and, ultimately, we all grow and become better versions of ourselves.
 
P.S. Here are some extra shots celebrating our bus manager, Kerryann, and our fantastic Tour Director!

yaounde.caption_text: We used the younger generation of Cameroonians as our models to signify EF's mission of opening the world through education. Cameroon is best known for football, hence the national team jerseys. The indomitable Lions of Cameroon, with notable names such as Roger Milla and Samuel Eto'o as flag bearers. The youths represent Cameroon's hope for a brighter future. We took our pictures at the reunification monument in Yaoundé, Cameroon.  The Reunification Monument recalls an important moment in Cameroon’s history, the political reunification of the “two Cameroons,” the Francophone and the Anglophone parts, in 1961, leading up to the birth of the United Republic of Cameroon (the geographical space called Cameroon) in 1972.

dead_sea.caption_text:
On the tour pictured, my husband and I used my Global Rewards points (that I earned as a high school teacher before coming to EF as a TC) to go on a GoAhead Tour to Israel, Jordan, and Egypt in the Summer of 2023. It was an incredible experience, and we loved every minute of it! I also got to dust off my Arabic a bit (I know VERY little), and I got my usual souvenir, a Harry Potter book in the language of the country I'm visiting!

EF has quite literally changed the trajectory of my life - I traveled with EF as a college student in 2009. I started planning my first EF tour my first year teaching and led that trip in 2017 to England and France, then I did the SAME itinerary with my students that I did as a college student to Italy & Greece in 2019, and took a whooping 76 students with me to Austria, Germany, and Switzerland in 2022. Earlier in 2022, I accepted a position at EF as a Tour Consultant for schools in Virginia, and now I get to help teachers in my community start travel programs in their schools! It's an absolute blast!

praia_pesqueira.caption_location: Waterfall Praia Pesqueira, Mioba, Praia Pesqueira
praia_pesqueira.caption_text: During my visit to the waterfalls in Mioba, São Tomé, I had the privilege of meeting the Mayor of the Mioba Community. He invited us to visit several homes and meet with families who were part of the community. Everyone was excited to meet Spaniards for the first time, and it was also a moving moment for us to experience the warmth and hospitality of the people. We took some photos with our instant cameras that we left in of the houses as a way for the families to remember our visit. Some of the local children joined us in exploring the waterfalls, and I had the pleasure of thanking one of the young girls by gifting her my pink EF sunglasses as a token of appreciation.

Working as an Activity Coordinator at EF has truly been one of the most transformative experiences of my life. Every day, I had the chance to meet incredible people from all over the world and be inspired by their stories, cultures, and perspectives. It went far beyond just organizing events — it was about building real connections, creating unforgettable memories, and growing both personally and professionally. This experience has shaped my mindset to be more open, empathetic, and globally aware. The friendships and lessons I’ve gained will stay with me for a lifetime.

dhaka.caption_text:
The Lalbagh Fort was built in the 17th century during the great Mughal period in South Asia. The pink fort used to be the Emperor's residence in the Bengal province, in the heart of Dhaka.

As a Bengali, I love how EF wants to open the world through education, more specifically the exchange of culture and language. I am extremely proud of my ancestor’s fight to preserve the right to speak our mother tongue (which is, according to UNESCO, the sweetest language in the world!).

tromso.caption_text: EF has given me the opportunity to learn about so many different parts of our world, from the culture in Ecuador, to the animals in Kenya, and the natural phenomenon of the aurora in Norway. More importantly, I am surrounded every day by a community of people who care and are passionate to learn about these things, many of whom have become my best friends!

Over my 9-year career at EF, I’ve had too many ‘wow, this is my job’ moments to count. Who can say they’ve hiked to Machu Picchu, marveled at the Grand Canyon, cheered on our pro cycling team at the Tour de France, and watched the sunrise over Angkor Wat.. all for work?! The impact on my life is immeasurable.

EF had challenged me to rethink what is possible. I’ve witnessed incredible logistical and operational feats in the face of challenging world events unexpected situations. As a member of the Go Ahead On-Tour Support team for 8+ years I know there’s nothing we can’t do. This mindset has pushed me to approach difficult situations with a level head, looking for creative solutions, using my resources and keeping a positive attitude. I know what it looks like to truly go above and beyond for our customers and I'm proud of the work we do every day.

Perhaps most impactful of all is the connection I have with my coworkers. We solve problems, support one another, celebrate life moments, and travel together. Being in the office energizes me, it’s a testament to the culture and environment we have cultivated together. Thank you EF!

lisbon.caption_text:
My EF experience in Malta had a profound impact on both my personal and professional life. Spending four weeks immersed in English, I not only improved my language skills but also gained a deeper understanding of different cultures by connecting with students from all over the world. This international exposure boosted my confidence and broadened my global perspective, which is essential in today’s interconnected world.

Being part of EF also helped me develop valuable soft skills, such as adaptability, communication, and teamwork, as I navigated living in a new environment. These experiences will undoubtedly be beneficial when I pursue the Job Club program in Vancouver in 2025, where I plan to work and live long-term. My time with EF has equipped me with the language skills and global mindset to successfully transition into professional life abroad.

Overall, EF has given me the tools and inspiration to pursue my dream of living and working in Vancouver, making it a crucial stepping stone in my journey toward building an international career.

uyuni.caption_text: My EF experience has been truly transformative, both personally and professionally. It has allowed me to connect with people from diverse backgrounds, broaden my perspective on the world, and refine my leadership skills. Guiding groups through Peru has deepened my appreciation for cultural exchange and the impact of travel on personal growth. Through EF, I’ve developed a stronger sense of adaptability, learning to navigate challenges with confidence and creativity. Whether managing logistics, ensuring group safety, or fostering meaningful experiences, I’ve grown in ways I never imagined. Seeing travelers form lasting friendships and gain new insights about themselves and the world is incredibly rewarding. On a personal level, this experience has reinforced my passion for exploration and connection. It has also inspired me to think bigger—exploring new business opportunities that align with my love for travel and adventure. EF has not just been a job; it has been a journey of growth, discovery, and impact that continues to shape my future.

british_columbia.caption_text: EF has been a big part of my life over the past 7 years. Pushing me to pursue my passion of exploring the world and continuously learning about myself and others along the way. During the pandemic, when I had to move to Canada from Denver, Colorado, to be with me now husband during that time, EF's Global presence allowed me to continue working for this amazing company during those tough years, by joining the EF Tours Canada Team instead. The impact that we have on the world and the next generation of global citizens continues to inspire me daily and I am incredibly proud to be part of it.

toronto.caption_text: My journey as the Host Family Coordinator at EF Toronto has been genuinely life-changing. Being part of a team that helps international students settle in comfortably and enjoy their time with EF has given me immense fulfillment. Knowing that I play a role in creating a welcoming and supportive environment for students from around the globe fills me with pride. Watching their happiness as they embrace new experiences and cultures is both inspiring and unforgettable. With my diverse educational background, I feel incredibly aligned with EF’s mission and values. I see a bright future for myself within this incredible organization, taking on multiple roles and contributing to its legacy of making a positive impact worldwide. EF has not only enriched the lives of students but also transformed my own professional journey, instilling a profound sense of purpose and connection. Also, i got my cabin crew to join me at a shot at best picture on a plane haha.

toronto.caption_location: In front of EF Toronto, 127 Portlanad, Toronto
toronto.caption_text: EF has had a huge impact on my life. It gave me the chance to study in a new country, improve my English, and meet amazing people from around the world. Thanks to EF, I feel more confident and independent. I’ve also learned how to move around a big city like Toronto on my own. This experience is helping me grow both personally and academically, and I’ll never forget it.

georgetown.caption_text: Greetings from Georgetown, Guyana! Thus, my daughter, Adrienne’s career with EF. There is not a time that she wakes up in the morning where she does not dream of the next visit on the horizon. That philosophy is instilled to all of her EF relationships, fellow teammates she influences and to the teachers she motivates. All the best from Guyana, the next big oil state…

california.caption_text: I went to EF San Diego for 3 weeks In the summer of 2023 - more precisely from the 26th of June to the 15th of july. EF changed my life! Now I have friends all over the world that I can visit whenever I need time off from my everyday life. I met some of the most amazing people during my trip and I’m so grateful I get to stay in contact with them still (even though it’s been over a year) I got to know myself really well during my trip as well and I wouldn’t be as social, relaxed or friendly as I am now if it hadn’t been for this trip. Forever grateful that I got to travel with EF.

A few colleagues from Cultural Care were able to make it out to San Francisco to represent EF and Cultural Care. Many of us proudly wore pink and got a chance to meet our cultural exchange program participants.

puerto_rico.caption_text: EF is not just a job or career, but a place that I have grown immensely, made amazing friends and experienced more magical experiences than I would have ever imagined.

I am a high school Special Ed English and journalism teacher. I run our school newspaper, coach lacrosse, and am the class of 2026 advisor. I took 19 of my best girls with me to PR where we had the experience of a lifetime. We did everything from shopping in Old San Juan, exploring El Morro, hiking caves and rainforest, learning in the nature reserve, to visiting Ponce, snorkeling in La Parguera, night swimming in the bioluminescent bay, learning how to salsa. cooking Mofongo, and overall embracing the Puerto Rican culture. EF, along with our tour guide, Yali, made it easy for us to simply enjoy our trip and make memories we will always cherish.
